admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
trustfund:
TF053218-WEST BANK AND GAZA BUDGET FACILITY,TF053220-WBGTF : PUBLIC FINANCIAL
            MANAGEMENT REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an emergency structural
            adjustment operation, being processed in parallel with the
            Public Financial Management Reform Trust Fund. It supports
            the same reform program, and requires the same prior actions
            for Board presentation. This operation recognizes the very
            significant progress that the Palestinian Authority (PA) has
            made in improving the quality of its financial management,
            and supports further improvements in this area. The
            operation is intended to provide budgetary support to the PA
            during a period of acute economic, and fiscal crisis,
            therefore it will help leverage contributions from other
            donors, by encouraging them to channel their funding through
            the new trust fund. The project seeks to help the PA avoid
            fiscal insolvency, contribute to the economic rehabilitation
            of the West Bank and Gaza, and, help advance the broader
            hope for peace, and stability in the region. There are
            nevertheless, internal and external risks to the program.
            Internally, two risks worth noting: first, it is the risk to
            the management of funds - however, as expressed in the
            recent Country Finance Accountability Assessment, a number
            of improvements, i.e., internal audit, financial control and
            payroll functions, provide assurance on eligible and
            budgeted expenditure spending; second, there is a political
            and administrative risk that the PA's public financial
            management reform program, could lose momentum, and stall.
            And, externally, there is a risk that the PA will be unable
            to obtain enough funding to cover its revenue gap, placing
            the operation effectiveness in doubt.
